args: Thanks to Ramona's ability to manipulate the\ntemperature of fire, the eastern blacksmith's\npublic forging was a great success.
Afterward, a man who witnessed the event\ncomes rushing over to her...
I am the master of this town's\nblacksmith guild.
I witnessed the display you put on earlier,\nand wanted to speak with you about it.
Uh oh. Did we need the guild's\npermission to do that?
Look, I'm sorry. It was just that—
Then what did you want to\nspeak with her about?
The strength of your flame was far greater\nthan one would expect of a fire started\nin the middle of the village street.
That was no ordinary fire. In fact,\nI think you have a very special ability.
Ah, forgive me. I didn't mean to\nraise your suspicions.
It's just that when I was yet an apprentice\nsmith, I found myself greatly indebted\nto someone with the same ability.
His name was Regis, and he was the\nfinest blacksmith I have ever known.
Oh, but it is an honor to meet the child\nof the man to whom I owe so much!
I was shocked when I caught word\nthat he had succumbed to illness.
The thought I would never again witness\nhis stunning artistry was...heartbreaking.
But I see I was mistaken, for your skill in\nforging is equal to his in every way!
Clearly, you have inherited his talent!
Still, let me come to my point.
As you appear your father's successor in\nevery sense, I have a favor to ask...

Would you not consider opening a smithy
in this town? Nothing would give me more
joy than having you support our guild with
your prodigious talents!

I know you would be a great success—
and once you win the trust of other guild
members, you'll likely find yourself in an
important post sooner rather than later.
Certainly a foreman. You may even find\nyourself in my position one day.
You think I could LEAD the guild?!

As I said, I saw what happened earlier—
and I quite agree that it's deplorable
when quality weapons do not receive
the recognition they deserve.
You believed this so strongly that you \ntook action, which made people appreciate\nthe importance of quality arms.
When we factor in your father's talents,\nI can hardly think of a person more fitting\nto lead our guild into the future.
You don't need to worry about me.
Oh, don't get me wrong—it would be\na huge blow if we were to lose you.
But the goal of this entire journey\nwas for you to grow as a blacksmith.
And now that you've done that,\nit's no wonder you find yourself\nthinking anew about the future.
If you want to join this guild—\nor lead it—I won't stop you.
Maybe just ask yourself what kind\nof blacksmith you want to be.
(He's not wrong—my goal WAS to\nexperience new things and grow.)
(And I've certainly met lots\nof different artisans.)
Our policy is to handle every part of our\nproducts with the same level of care—\neven those you don't ordinarily see.
Aye, minin' is the whole world to me.\nMay be daft when it comes to most things,\nbut I sure as hell know plenty 'bout THIS.
My desire for the user to return home\nis a secret wish I put into all of my work.
(Everyone I met took pride in doing\ntheir work to the best of their ability.)
(But what do I take pride in?\nWhat matters most to me?)
Don't skimp out on\nweapons, you hear?\nThey'll save your life.
I'm sorry, but I can't stay here.
I'm going home so I can keep making\nweapons for {player_name}.
I mean, I'm happy you said that, but still...
I've learned a lot on this journey.
I saw the work of a masterful tailor...\nMet a skilled, yet grumpy miner...
And I've seen the love that skilled\nsmiths hold for their customers.
But even with all that, my goal hasn't\nchanged from the day I met you.
Do you remember why I agreed to\nhelp you in the first place?
It's because I wanted to put hammer\nto iron in the name of peace.
My weapons are going to support you in\nbuilding an age free of conflict!
That's my goal, and it's important—\nI can't possibly abandon it now.
It sounds like you've thought this out.
Well, I'm certainly happy to\nkeep you in the fold!
I wasn't aware you were already\nin the midst of a major undertaking.
Still, we are happy to wait for true talent.\nOnce you've seen your work to completion,\nplease consider us anew.
I'll think about it for sure.
Welp, we better shake the lead out!\nWe've got a lot of folks waitin' for us.
Guess what? We've both been working\nhard, and we learned TONS of new skills!
I'm glad to hear that but—URK!—\nyou gotta stop squeezin' me so tight!
Welcome home, Sis!\nHow was the journey?
Rena...can you please...get her off me...?
Don't blame me—you're the one who\ndecided to gallivant across the land.
So how'd it go, huh? Tell us,\ntell us, tell uuuuuus!
I dunno—I have a LOT of stories.\nWe may have to stay up all night.
(Being surrounded by this kind of warmth\nreally makes it sink in that I'm home.)
(And now I can use everything I learned\nto help all three of us grow.)
The sisters talked late into the night.\nAnd the next day...
HEY! Don't go back to sleep!
Didn't you learn not to be a sleepyhead\non this magic journey of yours?!
Heh. It's good to have our old life back.
Mmm... Just a few more minutes...
